page.title: 19SEASONAL WORK.
page.content: Strawberry picking in July can either be "Pick your own" or picking to earn money.In P.Y.O. people arrive with containers and set about picking, when they have enough the fruit is weighed, paid for and taken home for jamming or for the freezer. To earn money is harder work with a man in charge to see each row is picked 'clean' and that you do not eat the fruit. People work at the apple orchard owned by Mr and Mrs Barclay in Aldbourough. Mr Barclay's father bought the farm in 1949 and planted 26 acres of coxs orange and 8 acres of other varities. He has 40 pickers in the late Summer- being so far east the picking is 7- 10 days later than the South.Early Summer people earn extra money 'Singling' the beet this means taking out weaker seedlings with a hoe, to make stronger plants.Account by Beverley,Adell,Marc.
